buildup.text: Emoji began in 1999 on Japanese mobile phones. Shigetaka Kurita designed 176 tiny pictograms.

discovery.text: They're technically Unicode characters â€” part of the same standard that encodes every letter and symbol.

twist.text: Each platform renders emoji differently. The same 'gun' emoji is a water pistol on Apple but realistic on others.

climax.text: New emoji are proposed yearly to the Unicode Consortium. Getting one approved takes 2+ years of lobbying.

punchline.text: Emoji aren't replacing language. They're extending typography into emotion.
